smell_analysis.justification: No empty diagrams found. All 19 diagrams contain at least one element. Pages 1-19 each contain multiple elements (actors, use cases, classes, states, tables, etc.).

On page 2 'Autode funktsionaalne allsüsteem (Vaata & Tuvasta)', the use case oval 'Tuvasta kasutaja' has ZERO actor associations. The actors (Uudistaja, Klienditeenindaja, Juhataja, Klient, Autode haldur) are positioned outside the system boundary and connect to the viewing use cases below, but there is no visible association line from any actor to 'Tuvasta kasutaja'.

No duplicate use cases describing the same activity with the same actor found. All use cases on pages 2-3 have distinct names and purposes: Tuvasta kasutaja, Vaata aktiivseid autosid, Vaata kõiki autosid, Vaata autode koondaruannet, Registreeri auto, Lõpeta auto, Muuda autot, Aktiveeri auto, Muuda auto mittaktiivseks, Vaata kõiki ootel või mitteaktiivseid autosid, Unusta auto.

No duplicate element names within the same package found. Each package (Isikute register, Klassifikaatorite register, Töötajate register, Autode register, Klientide register) contains uniquely named elements.

Common columns like 'nimetus' and 'on_aktiivne' appear in multiple classifier tables but represent different contexts (each classifier type has its own name and status). These are not redundant copies of the same data value. All data relationships are properly connected via FK relationships.

All use cases follow consistent verb-first naming pattern in Estonian. Page 2: Tuvasta kasutaja, Vaata aktiivseid autosid, Vaata kõiki autosid, Vaata autode koondaruannet. Page 3: Registreeri auto, Lõpeta auto, Muuda autot, Aktiveeri auto, Muuda auto mittaktiivseks, Vaata kõiki ootel või mitteaktiivseid autosid, Unusta auto. All start with active verbs (Tuvasta, Vaata, Registreeri, Lõpeta, Muuda, Aktiveeri, Unusta).

On page 9 'Auto seisundidiagramm', all states are reachable: Ootel has incoming from Algus (initial); Aktiivne has incoming from Ootel and Mitteaktiivne; Mitteaktiivne has incoming from Aktiivne; Lõpetatud has incoming from Aktiivne and Mitteaktiivne; Unustatud has incoming from Ootel. Every non-initial state has at least one incoming transition.

On page 4 'Auto lõpetamise tegevusdiagramm', all actions are reachable from the start node: Algus → Vaata kõiki autosid → decision nodes → Otsi autot / Vali auto → Lõpeta valitud auto. The flow path connects all actions to the start node through proper control flows and decision branches.

All relationships in class diagrams (pages 5-13) and database diagrams (pages 14-19) have multiplicity indicators on BOTH ends. Examples: Page 5 shows '1 - 0..*' for Isik-auto; Page 14 shows '+PK_Isik 1' and '+FK_Kasutajakonto_Isik 0..1' for Isik-Kasutajakonto; Page 17 shows '0..* - 1' patterns for all auto relationships.

Counted central elements on each diagram: Page 2: 4 use cases; Page 3: 7 use cases; Page 4: 4 actions; Page 5: 3 classes; Page 6: 6 classes; Page 7: 6 classes; Page 8: 6 classes; Page 9: 5 states (excluding initial pseudostate); Page 10: 5 classes; Page 11: 3 classes; Page 12: 7 classes; Page 13: 3 classes; Page 14: 4 tables; Page 15: 9 tables; Page 16: 3 tables; Page 17: 6 tables; Page 18: 2 tables; Page 19: 5 tables. Maximum is 9 on page 15. Threshold is ≥10. Since 9 < 10, smell is NOT present.

Counted visual connection lines for each class/table on each diagram. Maximum connections found: Page 6 Isik: 5 lines; Page 7 Klassifikaator: 5 inheritance lines; Page 12 auto: 4 lines; Page 17 auto: 4 lines; Page 19 Tootaja: 4 lines. Maximum across all diagrams is 5. Threshold is ≥6. Since 5 < 6, smell is NOT present.

Visual inspection of all diagrams shows reasonable element placement. Related elements are positioned near each other with no apparent distances exceeding twice the average distance between elements. All diagrams follow standard layout conventions.

All use cases start with active verbs in Estonian: Tuvasta (Identify), Vaata (View), Registreeri (Register), Lõpeta (End), Muuda (Change), Aktiveeri (Activate), Unusta (Forget). All activity diagram actions start with verbs: Vaata, Otsi (Search), Vali (Select), Lõpeta.

All class, table, attribute, and use case names have ≥4 characters. Shortest names found: 'Isik' (4 chars), 'auto' (4 chars), 'Riik' (4 chars). Threshold is ≤3 characters. Since 4 > 3, smell is NOT present.

The class 'auto' on pages 5, 11, 12 (class diagrams) and tables on pages 17, 18 (database diagrams) starts with a lowercase letter 'a' instead of uppercase 'A'. All other classes start with uppercase (Isik, Töötaja, Klient, Kasutajakonto, etc.) and are singular.

All attribute/column names start with lowercase letters. Verified across all class and database diagrams: e_meil, eesnimi, elukoht, isikukood, perenimi, reg_aeg, sünni_kp, viimase_muutm_aeg, on_aktiivne, parool, nimetus, mudel, etc. No uppercase-starting attributes found.

All database table names are singular: Isik, Kasutajakonto, Riik, Tootaja, Klient, auto, Auto_kategooria, Auto_mark, Tootaja_roll, Tootaja_rolli_omamine, auto_kategooria_omamine, etc. No plural table names found.

No type prefixes found in class, table, or attribute names. The prefixes PK_, FK_, pfK, and IXFK_ are present but are explicitly allowed per the rule for indicating primary keys, foreign keys, and indexes. No prohibited prefixes like tbl_, uc_, str, int were found.
